help.short: The management group.
lines: The management group with the given name where the policy set definition resides.

help.short: The name of the policy set definition.
The subscription name or ID.
lines: The subscription with the given name or ID where the policy set definition resides.

help.short: Additional properties to include in output
lines: Comma-separated list of additional properties to include in the command output. Supported values are 'LatestDefinitionVersion, EffectiveDefinitionVersion'.

help.short: The management group.
lines: The management group with the given name where the policy set definition resides.

help.short: The name of the policy set definition.
The subscription name or ID.
lines: The subscription with the given name or ID where the policy set definition resides.

help.short: The management group.
lines: The management group with the given name is where the policy definition will reside. It can be assigned only at scopes at or below this management group.

help.short: The name of the policy set definition.
The subscription name or ID.
lines: The subscription with the given name or ID is where the policy set definition will reside. It can be assigned only at scopes at or below this subscription.

help.short: Policy set definition description.
lines: Full description of the policy set definition.

help.short: The display name of the policy set definition.
lines: The display name of the policy set definition is not part of its ID, allowing for longer and more flexible naming.

help.short: The policy set definition metadata.
lines: The policy set definition metadata. Metadata is an open-ended object and is typically a collection of key value pairs.

help.short: The policy set definition parameter definitions.
lines: The definitions for parameters used in the policy rule. The keys are the parameter names.

help.short: The allowed values for the parameter.
The default value for the parameter if no value is provided.
General metadata for the parameter.

Set to true to have Azure portal create role assignments on the resource ID or resource scope value of this parameter during policy assignment. This property is useful in case you wish to assign permissions outside the assignment scope.
The description of the parameter.
The display name for the parameter.
Used when assigning the policy definition through the portal. Provides a context aware list of values for the user to choose from.

Provides validation of parameter inputs during assignment using a self-defined JSON schema. This property is only supported for object-type parameters and follows the Json.NET Schema 2019-09 implementation. You can learn more about using schemas at https://json-schema.org/ and test draft schemas at https://www.jsonschemavalidator.net/.
The data type of the parameter.
The metadata describing groups of policy definition references within the policy set definition.
A resource ID of a resource that contains additional metadata about the group.
The group's category.
The group's description.
The group's display name.
The name of the group.
An array of policy definition references.
The version of the policy definition to use.
The name of the groups that this policy definition reference belongs to.
The parameter values for the referenced policy rule. The keys are the parameter names.
The value of the parameter.
The ID of the policy definition or policy set definition.
A unique id (within the policy set definition) for this policy definition reference.
The type of policy set definition. Possible values are NotSpecified, BuiltIn, Custom, and Static.
The policy set definition version.
lines: The policy set definition version in #.#.# format.

help.short: A list of available versions for this policy definition.
